3. Tidying by category works like magic
Highlight (yellow) - Sentimental items: your parents’ home is not a haven for mementos > Page 114

When you think about your future, is it worth keeping mementos of things that you would otherwise forget? We live in the present. No matter how wonderful things used to be, we cannot live in the past. The joy and excitement we feel here and now are more important.
Highlight (blue) - Sentimental items: your parents’ home is not a haven for mementos > Page 116
If you just stow these things away in a drawer or cardboard box, before you realize it, your past will become a weight that holds you back and keeps you from living in the here and now.
Highlight (blue) - Sentimental items: your parents’ home is not a haven for mementos > Page 118

It is not our memories but the person we have become because of those past experiences that we should treasure. This is the lesson these keepsakes teach us when we sort them. The space in which we live should be for the person we are becoming now, not for the person we were in the past.
Highlight (yellow) - Reduce until you reach the point where something clicks > Page 125
As you put your house in order and decrease your possessions, you’ll see what your true values are, what is really important to you in your life.
5. The magic of tidying dramatically transforms your life
Highlight (blue) - Put your house in order and discover what you really want to do > Page 175
At their core, the things we really like do not change over time. Putting your house in order is a great way to discover what they are.
Highlight (pink) - Gaining confidence in life through the magic of tidying > Page 180

When it comes to the things I own, the clothes I wear, the house I live in, and the people in my life, when it comes to my environment as a whole, although it may not seem particularly special to anyone else, I am confident and extremely grateful to be surrounded by what I love, by things and people that are, each and every one, special, precious, and exceedingly dear to me. The things and people that bring me
Highlight (pink) - An attachment to the past or anxiety about the future > Page 181
But when we really delve into the reasons for why we can’t let something go, there are only two: an attachment to the past or a fear for the future.
Highlight (orange) - An attachment to the past or anxiety about the future > Page 183

When one or the other of these thought patterns makes it hard to throw things away, we can’t see what we really need now, at this moment. We aren’t sure what would satisfy us or what we are looking for. As a result, we increase the number of unnecessary possessions, burying ourselves both physically and mentally in superfluous things. The best way to find out what we really need is to get rid of what we don’t.
Highlight (yellow) - Your real life begins after putting your house in order > Page 204
As for you, pour your time and passion into what brings you the most joy, your mission in life.
